item.title: Efficient Multi-Hop Question Answering over Knowledge Graphs via LLM Planning and Embedding-Guided Search
item.description: arXiv:2511.19648v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Multi-hop question answering over knowledge graphs remains computationally challenging due to the combinatorial explosion of possible reasoning paths. Recent approaches rely on expensive Large Language Model (LLM) inference for both entity linking and...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> API, large language model, reasoning, LLM, embedding | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: Gender Bias in Emotion Recognition by Large Language Models
item.description: arXiv:2511.19785v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The rapid advancement of large language models (LLMs) and their growing integration into daily life underscore the importance of evaluating and ensuring their fairness. In this work, we examine fairness within the domain of emotional theory of mind, i...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> API, prompt, large language model, LLM, model | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
